fields.description: Экзамен IELTS (Международная система тестирования знания английского языка) - это система оценки, разработанная для подтверждения уровня владения языковыми навыками.
fields.name: Курс подготовки к IELTS

fields.description: xxxx
fields.name: dddddddssr

fields.description: Описание урока
Описание тестового урока Active
fields.name: Тестовый урока Active тестирование ввода слов в тексте

fields.description: Описание тестирование рефлексии ответа
fields.name: Тестирование рефлексии ответа

fields.description:
You have several library books that you are unable to return because a family member living in another city has fallen ill and you must go and take care of him/her. 


Write a letter to the library explaining the situation. In your letter

  • apologize for the inconvenience caused and
  • explain what you will do to get your books returned. 

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (1)

fields.description: Practicing IELTS General Writing (part 1)
fields.name: IELTS Letter (2)

fields.description:
You are organising a trip to the Snowy Mountains in New South Wales for a group of students from Perth in Western Australia. 

Write to the manager of Student Hostel Services and explain: 

  • when you want to visit the Snowy Mountains;
  • how long you will stay;
  • how many students are in your party, and 
  • what accommodation you will require. 

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (2)

fields.description:
You recently bought an item of clothing from a shop. You discovered that it had a fault and returned it to the shop for replacement or refund. However, the assistant told you that this was against the store's policy. 

Write a letter to the store manager. In your letter

  • explain the problems you have had
  • ask for a refund or exchange on the item. 
You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (3)

fields.description:
You have a friend who lives in a city abroad. You have decided that you would like to apply to do a course at one of the colleges in his/her city. 

Write to your friend explaining what you would like to do. In your letter

  • ask if you could stay with them while you are looking for accommodation  
  • ask your friend for advice regarding accommodation 

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (4)

fields.description:
You have had a bank account for a few years. Recently you received a letter from the hank stating that your account is $240 overdrawn and that you will he charged $70 which will be taken directly from your account. You know that this information is incorrect. 

Write a letter to the bank. Explain what has happened and say what you would like them to do about it. 
 You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (5)

fields.description:
The choice to smoke is made by smokers, who are aware of potential harm. Therefore, smokers should expect to pay more for medical treatment than non-smokers. 


To what extent do you agree with this statement? 

You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay general - 1

fields.description:
International entertainers, including sports personalities, often get paid millions of dollars per year. In your view, with widespread poverty in the world, are these huge earnings justified? Should there be a limit on how much one person can earn? 

Discuss this topic and provide reasons for your answer. 
You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay general - 2

fields.description:
Parents are the best teachers. 

To what extent do you agree/disagree with this statement? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer. You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay general - 3

fields.description:
Nowadays food is much  easier to prepare than 100-200 years ago. Is it a positive or a negative change? 

Discuss and provide reasons and examples to support your answer. 
You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay general - 4

fields.description:
As computers are increasingly being used in education, there will be soon no role for teachers in the classroom. 
To what extent do you agree/disagree with this statement? Provide reasons and examples to support your answer. 
You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay general - 5

fields.description:
Compare and contrast knowledge gained from practical experience with knowledge gained from reading. In your opinion, which source is more important? Why? 

You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay general - 6

fields.description:
Some people think that it is important to use leisure time for activities that improve the mind, such as reading and doing word puzzles.Others feel that it is important to rest the mind during leisure time. Is resting one's mind critical for our well-being or should we use any opportunity to improve our mind? 

You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay general - 7

fields.description:
Most high level jobs are done by men, therefore governments should reserve a certain percentage of these jobs for women. 
To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement? 


You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay general - 8

fields.description:
Famous people attract a lot of media attention. Is the lack of privacy an essential element of being famous or should famous people be protected from privacy invasion? 

Discuss and give your opinion. You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay general - 9

fields.description:
Should developing countries concentrate on improving industrial skills or should they promote education first?
 
Express your opinion and give reasons and examples to support your answer. 
You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay general - 10

fields.description:
We are becoming increasingly dependent on computers. They are used in business, hospitals, crime detection and even to fly planes. What things will they be used in the future? Is this dependence on computers a good thing or should we be more suspicious of their benefits?

You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay general - 11

fields.description:
Has modern technology improved our lives, or was life better when technology was simpler?
Discuss and provide reasons and examples to support your answer. 
You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay general - 12

fields.description:
Some people believe that schools are trying to teach children too many subjects. They feel that children will learn more if they focused on fewer subjects. 
To what extent do you agree/disagree with this opinion? 

You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay general - 13

fields.description:
Nowadays we are producing more and more rubbish. Why do you think this is happening and what can governments do to help reduce the amount of rubbish produced? 
Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience. 

You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay general - 14

fields.description:
If children behave badly, the parents should accept the responsibility for their children and also be punished. 
To what extent do you agree/disagree with this statement? Use reasons and examples to support your answer. 
You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay general - 15

fields.description:
PE (Physical Education/Sports) classes should be excluded from final years of school so that students can concentrate on academic subjects. 
To what extent do you agree/disagree with this statement? Use reasons and examples to support your answer. 
You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay general - 16

fields.description:
Will modern technology such as the Internet and E-books ever replace paper books? Why or why not? 
Give your opinion and provide reasons and examples to support your answer. 
You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay general - 17

fields.description:
Some people believe that families are not as close as they used to be. Do you agree/disagree with this opinion? 
Give reasons and examples to support your answer. 

You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay general - 18

fields.description:
In the past, buildings often reflected the culture of a society but today all modern buildings look alike and cities throughout the world are becoming more and more similar. 
What do you think about this trend? 
Give your opinion and provide reasons and examples to support your answer. 
You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay general - 19

fields.description:
Many people believe that women make better parents than men and that this is why they have traditionally had the greater role in raising children in most societies. Others claim that men are just as good as women at parenting. 

Give your opinion and provide reasons and examples to support your answer. 
You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay  general- 20

fields.description:
There are too many cars on the roads and governments should introduce restrictions on car use. 
To what extent do you agree/disagree with this statement? 
Provide reasons and examples to support your answers. 
You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay general- 21

fields.description:
The world population is growing and it’s important to control the number of children that families can have. If a couple would like to have more than 2 children, they should pay higher taxes. 
To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement? 
Give reasons and examples to support your answer. 
You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay  general- 22

fields.description:
Television programs harm most children. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement? 
Provide reasons and examples to support your answer. 
You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay  general- 23

fields.description:
In some societies more and more people choose to live alone. Why do you think this is? What are the advantages and disadvantages of living alone? 
Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples for your own knowledge or experience. 
You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay  general- 24

fields.description:
It has been more than 30 years since man first landed on the moon. Some people think that space research is a waste of money and that the resources would have been better spent on improving people’s lives. 
To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement? 
Give reasons and examples to support your answer. 
You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay  general- 25

fields.description:
You mistakenly left something valuable on a train. 

Write a letter to the train company explaining the situation. In your letter

  • describe the item you left behind and 
  • describe what you hope the company will do to help you. 

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (6)

fields.description:
You wish to participate in a work-related seminar in another city. 

Write a letter to the seminar organizer. In your letter

  • ask for detailed information regarding the dates, program, accommodations and cost. 

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (7)

fields.description:
You purchased a new camera; within a few days, you discover it has a major flaw. 

Write a letter to the manufacturer. In your letter 

  • introduce yourself
  • explain the situation
  • state what action you would like the manufacturer to take. 

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (8)

fields.description:
You recently accepted a part-time job. After a few weeks you find that there are several problems with the job. 

Write a letter to the manager of the company. In your letter 

  • describe the problems that you experienced and 
  • suggest what could be done about them. 

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (9)

fields.description:
You traveled by long distance bus recently and your suitcase was damaged. 

Write a letter to the bus company. In your letter 

  • inform the bus company of when and to where you traveled
  • describe your suitcase and what happened to it 
  • suggest what the bus company should do about the situation. 

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (10)

fields.description:
You recently had your computer fixed at the local computer store. However, you received poor service. 

Write a letter to the store manager. In your letter 

  • describe the situation
  • explain why you are dissatisfied
  • state what you want the manager to do. 

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (11)

fields.description:
You are going to visit New Zealand for an 'English and Homestay' program. You just received the details of your homestay host family. 

Write your first letter to the family. In your letter 

  • introduce yourself
  • ask the family a few questions to get information that is important to you
  • tell the family about your arrival date and time. 

Write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (12)

fields.description:
You are employed full-time and also taking a part-time evening course. You are not able to continue the course. 

Write a letter to the course lecturer. In the letter 

  • describe the situation
  • explain why you cannot continue the course and 
  • state what you will do about your situation. 

Write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (13)

fields.description:
For the past year you belonged to a local club. Now you want to discontinue your membership. 

Write a letter to the club secretary. In your letter 

  • state what type of membership you have
  • how you made your payments
  • give details of how you benefited from club membership
  • explain why you want to leave. 

Write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (14)

fields.description:
You are due to start a new job next week but you will not be able to because you have some problems. 

Write a letter to your new employer. In your letter 

  • explain your situation
  • describe your problems
  • tell him/her when you think you can start. 

Write at least 150 words
fields.name: IELTS letters (15)

fields.description:
You live near the airport and you are unhappy about a plan to make your local airport bigger and increase the number of flights. 

Write a letter to your local newspaper. In your letter 

  • explain where you live
  • describe the problem
  • give reasons why you do not want this development. 

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (16)

fields.description:
You have just returned home after living with a family in an English-speaking country for six months. You have realised that you left a small bag of personal possessions in your room. 

Write to the family. In your letter

  • describe the things you left behind;
  • ask them to send you the bag;
  • offer to cover the costs. 

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (17)

fields.description:
Last week you were on a flight to London. Unfortunately, when you left the plane, you left a folder with some documents. You did not remember about the folder until you got to your hotel. 

Write a letter to the airline. In your letter

  • explain what has happened
  • describe the folder and its contents and 
  • say what you would like them to do about it. 

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (18)

fields.description:
You are going to study in a college in the UK next year. You would like to stay in a college Hall of Residence. 

Write a letter to the college giving your accommodation requirements. 

  • You should outline what your room and food needs are and 
  • also ask what alternatives are available if they cannot provide what you want. 

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (19)

fields.description:
You celebrated your birthday with some friends last week in a restaurant. It was a great success and you and your friends enjoyed the evening very much. 

Write a letter to the restaurant. In your letter

  • thank them
  • mention the food, service and the atmosphere. 
  • also suggest any improvements. 

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (20)

fields.description:
You are an international student and have borrowed a book from the local public library. You left the book on a bus and when you contacted the bus company, they could not find it. 

Write a letter to the librarian. In your letter

  • explain the situation and 
  • ask what you should do. 

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (21)

fields.description:
You have just rented an unfurnished flat and a friend has told you that the Opportunity Shop in the shopping center has cheap second-hand furniture. 

Write to the shop owner. In your letter

  • describe what you need 
  • ask whether they have these items 
  • ask about the cost of the items. 

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (22)

fields.description:
Someone you know has asked you to babysit on Saturday and wants to know how much you charge per hour for this. Unfortunately, you already have a commitment this weekend and cannot help. However, you free the following weekend. 

Reply to your acquaintance. In your letter

  • explain that you are not able to help this time, but could help later. 
  • provide the fee details for your service. 

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (23)

fields.description:
You recently visited a place that had a strong impact on you. 

Write a letter to a friend about the place. In your letter 

  • explain where the place was and how you got there
  •  describe what you saw
  • offer to take your friend there. 

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (24)

fields.description:
You have recently heard that a friend of yours has had some problems as a result of some unusual weather. 

Write a letter to your friend. In your letter 

  • express concern 
  • tell them about a similar experience that you once had
  • give some advice or offer help. 

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (25)

fields.description:
Some people prefer to plan activities for their free time very carefully. Others choose not to make any plans at all for their free time. 

Compare the benefits of planning free-time with the benefits of not making plans.
Which do you prefer - planning or not planning for your leisure time?
Use specific reasons and examples to explain your choice.

You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay  general- 26

fields.description:
You have eaten at a restaurant and it was a terrible experience. 

Write a letter to the manager. In your letter

  • describe what happened and 
  • outline what you'd like the restaurant to do. 

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (26)

fields.description:
Your neighbours have recently written to you to complain about the noise from your house/flat. 

Write a letter to your neighbours. In your letter 

  • explain the reasons for the noise
  • apologise
  • describe what actions you will take. 
You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (27)

fields.description:
Some people say that advertising encourages us to buy things we really do not need. Others say that advertisements tell us about new products that may improve our lives. Which viewpoint do you agree with?
Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.

You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay general- 27

fields.description:
Write a letter to a friend who has invited you to stay with them in their country. 

In your letter

  • thank your friend for their invitation 
  • say when you are likely to visit 
  • say what you would like to do during the visit 

Write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (28)

fields.description:
Some people believe that the best way of learning about life is by listening to the advice of family and friends. Other people believe that the best way of learning about life is through personal experience. 

Compare the advantages of these two different ways of learning about life. Which do you think is preferable?
Use specific examples to support your preference.

You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay  general- 28

fields.description:
You plan to visit a town where you grew up. 

Write a letter to your school friend. In your letter

  • say when you plan to visit and how long you plan to stay for
  • invite them to meet
  • ask for advice on where you can meet 
You should write 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (29)

fields.description:
People should read only those books that are about real events, real people, and established facts. 

To what extent do you agree/disagree with this statement. 

Use specific reasons and details to support your opinion.

You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay  general- 29

fields.description:
One of your colleagues is about to retire. 

Write a letter to your colleagues. In your letter: 

  • suggest organizing a party for your colleague
  • discuss some dates/venues 
  • ask about a present for the colleague  
You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (30)

fields.description:
More and more people use credit cards instead of cash. Is it a positive or a negative process? 

Discuss and provide reasons and examples to support your answers. 

You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay  general- 30

fields.description:
You've been invited to a wedding, however you can't attend. 

Write a letter to the couple. In your letter

  • thank them for the invitation
  • explain why you can't attend
  • suggest meeting before or after the wedding to congratulate the couple

 You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (31)

fields.description:
It is a common knowledge that a healthy lifestyle is beneficial for people. Why is it that many people do not lead a healthy lifestyle? Discuss and provide reasons and examples to support your answer. 

You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay  general- 31

fields.description:
You faced a problem while staying in a hotel. The receptionist from the hotel assisted you.

Write a letter to the hotel manger. In your letter

  • explain what the problem was
  • thank the receptionist
  • suggest ways to avoid the problem in the future

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (32)

fields.description:
Nowadays many people take work home. 

Discuss advantages and disadvantages of working from home. Express your opinion whether it is good to work from home. Use reasons and examples to support your answer. 

You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay  general- 32

fields.description:
You plan to apply for a job and need to find a referee. Write a letter to your teacher. In your letter

  • provide the details of the job that you are applying for
  • explain why you are interested in this job
  • ask if you could list your teacher as a referee

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (33)

fields.description:
Some people believe that all university students need to study basic science. Others feel that it is not necessary. Discuss and give your opinion. Use reasons and examples to support your answer. 

You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay  general- 33

fields.description:
Your friend would like to come and stay with you. You are unable to host him/her. 


Write a letter to your friend. In your letter

  • explain why you can't host them
  • apologize
  • suggest another alternative

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (34)

fields.description:
Some people believe that all workers in a company should be able to participate in decision-making. Others feel that managers should make the decisions. 

Discuss and express your opinion. Give reasons and examples to support your answer. 

You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay  general- 34

fields.description:
You have recently had some renovation work in your house. You are not satisfied with the quality of the work.

Write a letter to the builder. In your letter:

  • describe what the problem is
  • explain what you would like the builder to do.

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (35)

fields.description:
More and more people nowadays move cities and even countries for work. Some people believe that it is a good thing. Others think that it is a negative thing. 

Discuss and provide your opinion. Use reasons and examples to support your answer. 

You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay  general- 35

fields.description:
A friend you met on holidays last year is planning to visit your city. 

Write a letter. In your letter

  • suggest the best time to visit your city
  • suggest some activities 
  • offer to meet and show him/her around

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (36)

fields.description:
Some people believe that salary is the most important factor in a job. Others feel that a good team can compensate for a lower salary. 

Discuss both opinions and express your opinion. Use reasons and examples to support your answer. 

You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay  general- 36

fields.description:
You are applying for a job. Write a cover letter to your potential employer.

In your letter highlight

  • your experience and qualifications 
  • why you believe you are a good candidate for this position.

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (37)

fields.description:
Many people are concerned that the majority of population are not exercising enough. Why do you think it is and what could be done to encourage people to exercise more. 

Give reasons and examples to support your answer.

You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay  general- 37

fields.description:
You have received presents and get-well cards from your colleagues. 

Write a letter to your colleagues. In your letter:

  • thank them for the presents
  • describe how you have used the presents 

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (38)

fields.description:
Cycling is good for the environment and health. Governments should encourage more people to use bicycles and tax car users. 

To what extent do you agree/disagree with this statement. Use reasons and examples to support your answer. 

You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay  general- 38

fields.description:
The area where you live has a traffic problem. Write a letter to your local council. 

In your letter

  • describe what the problem is
  • explain how it affects people
  • say what you would like the council to do

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (39)

fields.description:
Advertising is widespread and common. Why do you think advertising is effective? Is advertising a normal part of society or is it bad for the society? 

Give reasons and examples to support your answer. 

You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay  general- 39

fields.description:
You are planning to organize a party. 

Write a letter to your friend. In your letter

  • tell your friend about the party
  • invite them to attend
  • provide the details of the party

You should write at least 150 words.
fields.name: IELTS letters (40)

fields.description:
Tourism sometimes has a negative effect on the local places. Why do you think it happens and what could be done to prevent these negative effects? 

Use reasons and examples to support your answer. 

You should write at least 250 words.
fields.name: IELTS essay  general- 40
